{"step_by_step_thinking": "Polyglycolic acid suture material, also known as vicryl or Dexon, is a type of suture material used in surgery. It is not a natural material, but rather a synthetic one, made in a lab. Furthermore, it is designed to be absorbed by the body over time, which means it does not need to be removed after the wound has healed.", "answer_choice": "B. Absorbable synthetic suture"}
